summary: This document is a set of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, NY, for August 7, 2019. It details routine prison operations, counts, equipment checks, and inmate movements. The logs show the facility was holding inmates pending investigation and note a fire alarm system malfunction. This date is significant as it is the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.

persons.name: Corpening
persons.context: Listed as an inmate arriving on a bus from USP Canaan with registration number 19446-058 at 4:20 AM.

persons.name: Desilva
persons.context: An inmate placed in Administrative Detention pending an SIS investigation at 1:00 PM, with registration number 55381-066.

persons.name: Rene
persons.context: An inmate placed in Administrative Detention pending an SIS investigation at 12:45 PM, with registration number 08200-070.

events.title: MCC Daily Operations Log
events.description: Routine prison operations including multiple inmate counts, equipment checks, body alarm tests, inmate transfers, new commitments, and administrative detentions. A fire alarm and pump system was reported inoperable, requiring a fire watch.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: This log documents prison operations at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York on August 7, 2019, the day before Jeffrey Epstein's death in the same facility.
The log notes a malfunctioning fire alarm and sprinkler system, with a 'Control Center Fire Panel' exception and an inoperable pump, requiring a 'Fire Watch'.
Several inmates were held 'pending bed space' in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) and observation quarters, and at least two were placed in Administrative Detention 'pending SIS investigation'.
The log shows routine inmate movements, including new commitments, releases, and transfers between units like general population, SHU, and holding.
Standard security procedures like body alarm testing, metal detector checks, roof checks, and multiple inmate counts were conducted throughout the day.
